title: 109_hr377
content: The Act is titled the "Honoring Every Requirement of Exemplary Service Act of 2005" or the "HEROES Act of 2005". It includes enhancements to death gratuity. The HEROES Act of 2005 includes enhancements to death gratuity, with a death gratuity of $100,000 for deaths resulting from combat-related causes or causes incurred in designated operations or areas. The HEROES Act of 2005 increases death gratuity for combat-related deaths or deaths in designated operations or areas. The death gratuity amount is now $100,000. The HEROES Act of 2005 increases death gratuity for combat-related deaths or deaths in designated operations or areas to $100,000. Subsection (a) of the Act is further amended to adjust the gratuity under subsection (d) instead of subsection (c). Additionally, a requirement for an additional gratuity for deaths before the effective date is outlined, to be paid by the Secretary of the military department concerned. The HEROES Act of 2005 increases death gratuity for combat-related deaths or deaths in designated operations to $100,000. An additional death gratuity of $238,000 is provided for members of the Armed Forces who died before the enactment of the Act as a direct result of wounds, injuries, or illnesses incurred in specific operations or areas. The additional death gratuity of $238,000 is provided to beneficiaries entitled to the regular military death gratuity under specific conditions outlined in the HEROES Act of 2005. The additional death gratuity payable to beneficiaries is determined based on the ratio of the regular military death gratuity share each beneficiary is entitled to. The additional death gratuity is defined as the death gratuity provided under specific conditions outlined in the HEROES Act of 2005. Enhancements to Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance are outlined in Section 3. Increased maximum amount under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance to $400,000 or a lesser amount chosen by the member. Additional coverage available for certain members. The maximum amount under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance has been increased to $400,000, with additional coverage available for members serving in certain areas or operations. New subsection (e) provides additional insurance coverage of $150,000 for members who die as a result of wounds, injuries, or illnesses incurred while serving in designated combat operations or zones. This is in addition to the increased maximum amount of $400,000 under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance. The new subsection provides an additional $150,000 insurance coverage for members serving in designated combat operations, with a total limit of $400,000. Contributions for the $150,000 coverage cannot be deducted from the member's pay while serving. The cost of insurance for $150,000 coverage under this subchapter cannot be deducted from the member's pay. Funding for this coverage is contributed from the appropriation for active duty pay of the uniformed service concerned. The Secretary determines and certifies the cost of Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance, funded from the appropriation for active duty pay. Section 1967 is amended to increase coverage to $400,000 and coordination with VGLI is specified. The amendment increases coverage to $400,000 for Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance and specifies coordination with Veterans' Group Life Insurance. Additionally, regulations are added regarding member elections to reduce or decline insurance, including providing notice to the member's spouse. The amendment requires written consent from a member's spouse for any election to not be insured under the subchapter or to be insured for less than the maximum amount. Additionally, a new requirement is added for the redesignation of beneficiaries under Section 1970 of the title. The amendment mandates written spousal consent for any changes to insurance coverage or beneficiary designations. The effective date for these requirements is more than 90 days after the enactment of the Act.
